page.title: 05ROA ISLAND "WATCHTOWER"
page.content: The area of Roa Island was obviously seen,in the past,as a possible smuggler's haven because in 1849 a Customs House was built here overlooking Piel Deepwater channel.In fact this Customs post had been on Piel Island until 1760,then it was moved to Ulverston,coming back to Piel by 1849. The Customs House contains a boat house from where the local customs officer could sail out into the channel,board the boats and check their cargo.As the iron ore trade declined then the Customs House passed into the hands of Roa Island Mission who held services there on every 2nd Sunday.The "watch Tower"is now disused,all its windows being bricked /concreted up.
